The claim was based on data from a St: Louis Post-Dispatch column in 2014, which cited 2012 census numbers indicating that 47 percent of the metro area's African-American men between ages 16 and 24 were unemployed.
The statement made by Lt: Gov. Peter Kinder, which included the claim, was analyzed for accuracy and context.
The expert consulted was Peter Muesser: a professor of labor economics at MU, who confirmed that the youth jobless rate cited by Kinder seemed to be in the correct range based on Census Bureau information.
The demographic makeup of St: Louis City and Ferguson was examined to determine the relevance of the claim to minority communities, considering the significantly larger African-American population in Ferguson compared to St. Louis City.
